title: Smoking: a double standard
brief_description: Looks at double standards in the marketing of cigarettes. Government warnings about the effects of tar content in cigarettes have caused a fall in the number of smokers in Britain and the USA. Cigarette companies are now selling to the third world countries where there are no marketing controls. Suitable for secondary level.
